title: Hidden Valley Baked Ranch Chicken Recipe
description: A very simple coating of ranch seasoning on chicken breasts drenched with butter adds incredible flavor to this effortless yet satisfying main dish.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Trusted Brands: Recipes and Tips Hidden Valley® Hidden Valley Baked Ranch Chicken 4.6 (8) 5 Reviews 2 Photos With melted butter and ranch seasoning, chicken breasts are roasted effortlessly in this satisfying main dish. Submitted by Hidden Valley Ranch Updated on November 11, 2023 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo Prep Time: 5 mins Cook Time: 20 mins Additional Time: 5 mins Total Time: 30 mins Servings: 4 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 4 servings 4 boneless, skinless chicken breasts 2 tablespoons melted butter 2 teaspoons Hidden Valley Original Ranch Salad Dressing and Seasoning Mix Directions Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). If thinner chicken breasts are desired, place chicken between two sheets of heavy plastic on a solid, level surface. Firmly pound chicken with the smooth side of a meat mallet to a 3/4-inch thickness. Place chicken into a large baking dish. Brush with melted butter on both sides, then season all over with ranch seasoning mix. Drizzle any remaining butter over top. Bake in the preheated oven until chicken is no longer pink in the center and the juices run clear, 18 to 20 minutes. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C). Remove from the oven and let rest for a few minutes before serving. Recipe Tip Feel free to use olive oil instead of butter. name: Hidden Valley Ranch
instructions: Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).;If thinner chicken breasts are desired, place chicken between two sheets of heavy plastic on a solid, level surface. Firmly pound chicken with the smooth side of a meat mallet to a 3/4-inch thickness.;Place chicken into a large baking dish. Brush with melted butter on both sides, then season all over with ranch seasoning mix. Drizzle any remaining butter over top.;Bake in the preheated oven until chicken is no longer pink in the center and the juices run clear, 18 to 20 minutes. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C). Remove from the oven and let rest for a few minutes before serving.
